ref: 13185 samayá m. ʻ meeting ʼ ŚBr., ʻ rule ʼ AV., ʻ agreement ʼ TS., ʻ time ʼ MBh. [√i2]
Pa. samaya -- m. ʻ coming together, intercourse, time, point of time ʼ;

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart

ref: Sh. (Lor.) samu thoiki ʻ to collect ʼ;
L. samā m. ʻ season, good season, prosperity ʼ (or < sámā -- ?);
G. samɔ m. ʻ time, occasion, season ʼ;
M. save ʻ at the moment of (dawn) ʼ LM 416 < samayēna, emph. savẽċ ʻ immediately, spontaneously ʼ (or < svayam ēva?);
Si. inscr. samiyen inst. ʻ covenant ʼ, samā, seme ʻ time ʼ. --
H. samā m. ʻ time ʼ prob., samai certainly ←
